newsitem.title: UK: BP opens first service station in Russia.
newsitem.headline: BP opens first service station in Russia.

text.p: British Petroleum Plc, the oil company, said on Tuesday it had opened its first Russian service station in the country's capital Moscow.

The complex, which offers more than 2,00 product lines ranging from car parts to groceries, is a joint development with U.S. burger chain McDonalds which has built a drive-in restaurant into the site.
The site is passed by 80,000 cars a day, said a BP statement. The station will be open 24 hours a day and will employ 35 people.
If successful, BP said it hoped to add more sites in the city in 1997.
